name: Corn
description: A cereal plant that yields large grains, or kernels, set in rows on a cob.

name: Wheat
description: A cereal plant that is the most important kind grown in temperate countries, the grain of which is ground to make flour for bread, pasta, pastry, etc.

name: Rice
description: A swamp grass which is widely cultivated as a source of food, especially in Asia.

name: Barley
description: A hardy cereal that has coarse bristles extending from the ears. It is widely cultivated, chiefly for use in brewing and stockfeed.

name: Soybean
description: A species of legume native to East Asia, widely grown for its edible bean which has numerous uses.

name: Oat
description: A cereal plant cultivated chiefly in cool climates and widely used for animal feed as well as human consumption.

name: Rye
description: A wheat-like cereal plant that tolerates poor soils and low temperatures.

name: Millet
description: A fast-growing cereal plant that is widely grown in warm countries and regions with poor soils.

name: Sorghum
description: A genus of flowering plants in the grass family, which includes species grown for grain, for fodder, and for the production of alcoholic beverages.

name: Buckwheat
description: A plant cultivated for its grain-like seeds, and also used as a cover crop.

name: Sunflower
description: A large annual forb of the genus Helianthus grown as a crop for its edible oil and seeds.

name: Canola
description: A type of rapeseed that is low in erucic acid, as used for the production of canola oil and meal.

name: Flax
description: A food and fiber crop cultivated in cooler regions of the world.

name: Peanut
description: A legume crop grown mainly for its edible seeds, classified as a grain legume and also as an oil crop due to its high oil content.

name: Lentil
description: An edible pulse typically known for its lens-shaped seeds.

name: Pea
description: A small spherical seed or the seed-pod of the pod fruit Pisum sativum; each pod contains several peas.

name: Chickpea
description: An annual legume of the family Fabaceae, subfamily Faboideae. Its seeds are high in protein.

name: Alfalfa
description: A perennial flowering plant in the legume family, cultivated as an important forage crop in many countries around the world.

name: Clover
description: A herbaceous, perennial plant which is often used in pastures for cattle feeding.

name: Quinoa
description: An annual seed-producing flowering plant grown as a grain crop for its edible seeds.
